abstract.text: Increase or decrease the price of an auto-renewable subscription, a bundle, or individual items within a subscription at the next renewal.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: A transaction identifier of the auto-renewable subscription that is subject to the price change. Use the subscription’s original transaction ID or any subsequent transaction ID of a transaction related to the subscription.
The request body that contains the details of the price change.

Call this endpoint as the final step in changing the price of a subscription or any bundle or item within it. Based on the type of price change, you might need to communicate the change to customers or get their consent. For information about the communication requirements including their timing, see

Only active subscriptions that aren’t in a billing retry state are eligible for price changes. When you call this endpoint, the price change takes effect at the next subscription renewal. Call the endpoint no later than 24 hours before the renewal date to have it take effect at the renewal.
For information about providing prices, see

content.text: Inform customers and get consent if needed

inlineContent.text: Determine whether you need to communicate a price change to the customer, as follows:
Decreasing the price doesn’t require any communications with the customer. You can call this endpoint anytime you want to decrease prices.

Increasing subscription prices requires you to notify the customer in advance. Some price increases also require you to obtain the customer’s consent. To determine whether you need price consent and for information about customer communications and their timing, see

You need to communicate price increases to your customer, including through email, in-app messaging, and push notifications. To determine whether you need price consent and for information about customer communications and their timing, see
If you’re increasing the price of any SKU associated with a subscription (such as the subscription itself, a bundle, or an individual item), follow these steps:
Determine whether the price increase requires customer consent.
If the increase doesn’t require customer consent, notify the customer of the price increase in advance, as described in
. Then, call this endpoint after you notify the customer.

If the increase requires customer consent, call this endpoint only if you’ve obtained the customer’s consent.  If you don’t obtain the customer’s consent to increase the price, don’t call this endpoint, and preserve the existing price.

abstract.text: Support In-App Purchases through the App Store for exceptionally large catalogs of custom one-time purchases, subscriptions, and subscriptions with optional add-ons.
Increase or decrease the price of an auto-renewable subscription, a bundle, or individual items within a subscription at the next renewal.
The request body you use to change the price of an auto-renewable subscription.
A response that contains signed JWS renewal and JWS transaction information after a subscription price change request.
Create JSON Web Tokens (JWTs) to authorize Advanced Commerce requests from your server.

doc://com.apple.advancedcommerceapi/docu.title: Authorizing API requests from your server

abstract.text: Provide necessary customer communications to notify and gather applicable consent before you initiate a price change.
Provide prices for SKUs with the supported number of decimal places, in milliunits of currency.

doc://com.apple.advancedcommerceapi/docu.title: Specifying prices for Advanced Commerce SKUs

abstract.text: Recognize and handle the rate limits that apply to Advanced Commerce API endpoints.

doc://com.apple.advancedcommerceapi/docu.title: Identifying rate limits for Advanced Commerce APIs

seeAlsoSections.title: Subscription price change from the server
